page.title: 04Ecology around Langho (1)
page.content: The climate is cool temperate , we have enough rain to encourage plant life , 40 to 50 inches yearly , summers warm rather than hot , few days of intense frost and little snow ; winds mainly S.W. Enviroments include moor , farm , domestic and aquatic . Larger trees are usually in small clumps ; oak , ash , sycamore , with alder on damp ground . Mature hedgerows are severely trimmed along roads , straggly between fields ; hawthorne , elder , hazel , rose , holly , blackthorn , guelder rose ; many flowering plants grow below ;foxgloves, stitchwort , dock , ivy , plantain , arum , bramble , lately convulvulus near higher roads and the golf course heather and bilberry . Banks of streams have liverwort , moss and ferns .
